text: A United Nations Parliamentary Assembly (UNPA) is a proposed idea to add to the United Nations System. The idea was raised at the founding of the League of Nations in the 1920s and again following the end of World War II in 1945. It has received the support of over 1,600 members of parliament from over 100 countries worldwide.CUNPA, Supporters: http://en.unpacampaign.org/supporters/ Retrieved 2 February 2020 ==References== Category:United Nations
title: United Nations Parliamentary Assembly
